task.title: How to save money doing laundry at home
task.shortdesc: Learn budget-friendly laundry tips to save money on water, energy, and detergent while ensuring your clothes are clean and well-maintained.

taskbody.context: As a student, laundry expenses can add up quickly. Here are some practical tips to save money while making the most of your resources.

step.cmd: Wash full loads only: Wait until you have a full load to reduce the number of cycles you need to run. This saves water, energy, and detergent. Avoid overloading, because it can reduce cleaning effectiveness.
Use cold water: Washing with cold water saves energy because it doesn’t require heating. Most clothes get just as clean in cold water, and it helps prevent colors from fading.
Choose affordable and efficient detergent: Buy store-brand detergent, which is usually cheaper. Look for concentrated formulas that require less per wash, helping you save money over time.
Air dry when possible: Avoid using the dryer to save on energy costs. Air drying clothes on a rack or hangers is free, and it also helps your clothes last longer.
Skip fabric softener: Fabric softeners can be an extra cost, and they’re not necessary for every load.
Clean your washing machine regularly: A clean washer operates more efficiently, helping your clothes come out cleaner in less time. Run an empty cycle with vinegar once a month to remove buildup.
